intro: We use only certified organic, non-toxic colour powders made from cornstarch and food-grade dyes. Here's how to enjoy the colours safely.

sections.title: About Our Colours
items: All colours are certified organic and non-toxic
Made from cornstarch and food-grade dyes
Colours wash out of most fabrics â€” but we recommend wearing clothes you don't mind staining
Free colour powder packets available at the entrance (limited supply)

sections.title: Eye Protection
items: Wear sunglasses during colour throws for best protection
If colour gets in your eyes, rinse immediately with cold clean water for at least 15 minutes
Do NOT rub your eyes â€” this can cause irritation
If irritation persists, visit the First Aid tent immediately
Consider wearing contact lenses with sunglasses, or switch to glasses for the day

sections.title: Skin Protection
items: Apply coconut oil or moisturiser to exposed skin BEFORE the event â€” this creates a barrier and makes cleanup much easier
Apply sunscreen (SPF 30+) generously â€” you'll be outdoors for hours
If you have sensitive skin or eczema, apply a thicker layer of barrier cream
Colour may stain nails â€” apply a clear coat of nail polish beforehand if desired

sections.title: Breathing & Respiratory
items: During intense colour throws, use a scarf or bandana to cover your nose and mouth
If you have asthma, carry your inhaler and stay on the edges of colour zones
If you experience difficulty breathing, move to fresh air immediately and visit First Aid
Children should be supervised closely during colour throws

sections.title: Protecting Your Phone & Valuables
items: Put your phone in a zip-lock bag â€” it still works through the plastic!
Leave expensive jewellery, watches, and electronics at home or in your car
Bring a small sealed bag for your wallet, keys, and cards
Waterproof phone pouches are available at the Info Desk

sections.title: What to Wear
items: White or light-coloured clothes are traditional â€” and show colours beautifully!
Wear old clothes that you don't mind getting permanently colourful
Closed-toe shoes are recommended (avoid sandals â€” slippery when wet)
Avoid silk, satin, and other delicate fabrics
Bring a change of clothes for the journey home

sections.title: Children's Safety
items: Supervise children at all times during colour throws
Apply extra barrier cream/oil to children's skin
Sunglasses are especially recommended for little ones
The Kids' Activity Zone is a gentler colour play area
Ensure children stay hydrated â€” they may forget to drink when having fun!

sections.title: After the Festival
items: Rinse off colour with lukewarm water first â€” hot water can set the colour
Use oil (coconut, olive, or baby oil) on stubborn colour patches before washing
Shampoo hair 2-3 times â€” a clarifying shampoo works best
Moisturise skin after washing to prevent dryness
Most colours fade within 1-2 washes from skin, 2-3 washes from hair
